str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
From an obsolete primary noun; 'ever, 'by qualification regularly; by implication, earnestly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Mortal, subject to death. From thnesko; liable to die.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
